channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: @wjfarr @DumasRaphael https://t.co/hn25I25qZw
@dailysimpsons https://t.co/pJStWDrGfu

I took at call at work today, and the customer was looking for someone named Richard who wasn‚Äôt me, so I thought he was asking for the other Richard in my department, but it was actually for someone we call Rich, not in my department. Now I can‚Äôt stop thinking about Mrs. Bucket. https://t.co/gdmuUOUArE

Today was Tall Women Day in Toronto, evidently. #TallWomenDay
Looks like I was out of town for Tall Women Day last year. That‚Äôs why I missed it. #TallWomenDay
It‚Äôs weird that Tall Women Day isn‚Äôt on a predictable day. It was in September in 2020, November in 2021, and July in 2022. Huh? #TallWomenDay
Is St√©phane Dion the Canadian ambassador to France yet?
I prefer Governing By Threading the Needle to Governing By Trial Balloon. https://t.co/DZLjCtDaDX

You know what‚Äôs irritating? News anchors talking over the first few words of a speech they are about to cover. You know what they could do instead, and very few people would care? Delay the feed of the speech ever so slightly so that we get to hear everything.
Sports broadcasts do it all the time, not so much for speeches or news conferences, but for the live events they cover, and it‚Äôs so fluid that hardly anybody notices.
The next time you watch a baseball game on TV, notice how, when the broadcasts show a pitcher up close, they very slightly rewind the action once the pitch is actually made.

@BovyMaltz Being a mutual follower of someone, but suspecting that each of us is no longer interested in what the other has to say anymore, is definitely a thing, and we need a social convention for mutually unfollowing without any hard feelings.
This includes a spoiler of my favourite subtlety of the movie. https://t.co/qaEekuWJwd
I hate AI art, but I love the AI that turns photos and paintings of people into short videos. ü§î
*Owen Wilson Wow* https://t.co/ffgbYgOymQ
Uh oh. https://t.co/O1UYukGmyy

Twitter needs a ‚ÄúThis tweet has been dunked on enough already!‚Äù warning label.
A quick mockup. https://t.co/105d4VLEu8
A better mockup would have a basketball hoop icon for the ‚ÄúView current dunks‚Äù option.
A more serious way that Twitter could do it is to alter the Quote Tweet function so that it notes how many quote tweets already exist, and offer people the option to look at them first and just retweet one of those.
I‚Äôd follow accounts that are ‚Äú[X] but without the dunks‚Äù much like how @newyorker_nb is the ‚ÄúAll the New Yorker, none of the Borowitz.‚Äù
@CatherineOmega Do we have someone to name this law of headlines after? You know what happens if we don‚Äôt, right?
So far, 2022 is flying by. https://t.co/tUSj2nBZgj

*Owen Wilson Wow* https://t.co/N569CzrdcR
üçø https://t.co/OLGj03BehB
üçø https://t.co/ZiVHkDtuwA
I could still use more specific dates on when not to tell my crushes I‚Äôm in love with them, but this at least gives me some idea of how to plan that. https://t.co/TtaBgEvfVU
I finally bought an air fryer. I surrender!
Is there anything that isn‚Äôt in crisis these days?
@AnakanaSchofiel How do they know when the most inopportune moment is? The car tires, I mean.

Like movies? Like sports? Live in Toronto? Then you might also like @PaidInSweat, a film program specializing in sports-esque, and sports-adjacent films curated by @nostalgiaphile, screening at @RevueCinema.
Is this a lot of streetcars? https://t.co/TEaCQiIUGs

@CatherineOmega @Kimli I caved and I‚Äôm giving work what it wants: A slightly less happy employee. They framed it as protecting my personal information (if a matter goes before a court and my laptop is subpoenaed, etc. etc.), though well, well after the fact.
@DumasRaphael If it were me, I‚Äôd be tempted to write back ‚ÄúNot sure if I‚Äôll be at the party. Can you tell me now?‚Äù
@Kimli Welcome to my world. https://t.co/CxreGlVWms
